intro: Llerasia beckii, commonly known as the Peruvian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in moist, shaded areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its flowers range in color from white to purple. Llerasia beckii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
